Key Match Events: Granit Xhaka was sent off in a fiery clash between Denmark and Switzerland
Silvan Widmer was booked for wasting time
Nico Elvedi was sent off for a last-man foul on Kasper Dolberg
Denmark took the lead through Patrick Dorgu
Granit Xhaka caught Spurs loanee Hojbjerg with a very late challenge – albeit a relatively harmless one – and was shown a second yellow card
Post-Match Reflections: Joachim Andersen said of Xhaka after the game: 'He is a top footballer, but he is also a bit of a b***h'

Andersen continued: 'We know Granit, and he can go to it once in a while and get a little angry on the pitch. That’s the way it is. He is a player I have a lot of respect for, and sometimes you can lose your head.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game sparked into life in the second period
Switzerland managed to hold out at 0-0 with 10 men until the final eight minutes of the game
Others: Switzerland’s Breel Embolo writhing on the ground claiming a foul
Denmark ran up the other end and took the lead through Patrick Dorgu
Granit Xhaka was incensed by the decision
A few minutes later, Xhaka caught Spurs loanee Hojbjerg with a very late challenge – albeit a relatively harmless one – and was shown a second yellow card
Hojbjerg went on to score a second for Denmark, who took all three points from the contest
